pageContext.description: spiral in 3 coils  [THIS INFO ACTUALLY WRITTEN UNDER COMPOSITION].
pageContext.other: Under ASSOCIATIONS, number of coiled rings originally read 2, which has been struck out and replaced by "3.", In TITLE, the number 2 has been inserted in pencil and different handwriting before the word "Rings.", Lines 2-4 of SITE info are in different handwriting and ink, written over white-out label., 4-part, hand-drawn illustration.
pageContext.publications: Arch. Journ. V, 323, fig., Evans pp 464 etc.  [THIS NOTATION IN PENCIL AND IN DIFFERENT HANDWRITING]
pageContext.rightCorner: RED DOT, followed by the notation in pencil:, C.
pageContext.collection: British Museum, 1853-4-12  14, 15,, Purchased from Reginald Martell, Esq.
pageContext.site: England, SUSSEX (EAST),, Brighton,, Stanmer, Hollingbury Hill,, All found carefully laid out in an excavation in the chalk, under a low mound in 1825.,,
pageContext.remarks: a votive deposit of the Middle Bronze Age, LOWER RIGHT CORNER [in pencil]:, C 1
